text:
I don't remember much from my childhood. I was an introverted and quiet kid, often keeping to myself and avoiding social interactions. I was always a conscientious person, and I worked hard to do well in school. I was never the most popular kid, but I had a few close friends that I felt comfortable around. 

My parents were loving and supportive, but I was never able to open up to them. I was anxious and neurotic, and my thoughts and emotions were often overwhelming. I was always conscious of the way I was perceived by others, and I was afraid of failing or embarrassing myself. I was also closed off to new experiences, preferring to stick to what I knew. 

I spent a lot of my time alone, reading or doing puzzles. I was drawn to books and stories, and I loved to get lost in the world of the characters. I enjoyed the solitude, and I often found comfort in being alone. I was also quite creative, and I would often imagine new stories and worlds of my own. 

I was a sensitive kid, and I often felt neglected or misunderstood. I was easily hurt by the words and actions of others, and I found it hard to make new friends. I was often jealous of those who seemed to have it all, and I was envious of those who had more attention and affection than me. 

My parents tried to encourage me to be more open and take risks, but I was too afraid of failure. I was often hard on myself, and I was never satisfied with my efforts. I felt like I had to be perfect and that anything less than that was unacceptable. I was very conscientious and worked hard to do well, but I was never able to get the recognition that I wanted.

Despite my introverted nature, I was an active child who loved to explore and learn new things. I had a keen interest in science and nature, and I would often spend hours outside in the garden or on nature walks. I was also passionate about music and art, and I found solace in poetry and playing the piano. 

I was also quite competitive and loved to play sports, although I wasn’t particularly good at them. I was never the star player, but I always tried my best and enjoyed the challenge. I was also a bit of a perfectionist, and I was never satisfied with my performance.

Although I was an introverted and often anxious kid, I was still able to find joy in the small moments of life. I learned to appreciate the beauty in the everyday, and I found comfort in nature and the people I loved. I was never the most outgoing or happy-go-lucky kid, but I was able to find moments of peace and contentment in my life.
prompt:

Here are a number of characteristics that may or may not apply to you. For example, do you agree that you are someone who likes to spend time with others? Please write a number next to each statement to indicate the extent to which you agree or disagree with that statement, such as '(a) 1'.

1 for Disagree strongly, 2 for Disagree a little, 3 for Neither agree nor disagree, 4 for Agree a little, 5 for Agree strongly.
